edu.ncsu.csc216.flix_2.customer

Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.flix_2.customer.Customer

  • public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the customer object. It holds the current state of any given customer including username, password, max number of movies at home, number of movies currently at home, movies in this customer's reserve queue, and the movies in this customer's queue at home.
    Author:
    Eric Matysek, Nick Brust

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Customer(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String password, int maxAtHome)
      Constructs a new Customer object given the username, passworde, and max allowed movies at home.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Customer

        public Customer(java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.String password,
                int maxAtHome)
        Constructs a new Customer object given the username, passworde, and max allowed movies at home. This constructor checks for empty strings, and incorrect values of maxAtHome. If the value passed for maxAtHome is negative, it is re-set to zero. If an empty string or null is passed for the username or password, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        id - The username for the customer.
        password - The password for the customer.
        maxAtHome - The maximum allowed movies this customer can have at home at any given time.

    • Method Detail

      • verifyPassword

        public boolean verifyPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Checks if the password provided matches the password of this customer.
        Parameters:
        password - The entered password.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the password matches, false otherwise.

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Returns the username of the customer.
        Returns:
        Returns the username of the customer.

      • compareToByName

        public int compareToByName(Customer customer)
        Compares the given customer's username to this customer's username. If the two usernames are the same, 0 is returned; a value less than 0 if this customer's username is lexicographically less than the given customer's username; a value greater than 0 if this customer's username is lexicographically greater than the give customer's username.
        Parameters:
        customer - The customer whose username to compare to.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the two usernames are the same; a value less than 0 if this customer's username is lexicographically less than the given customer's username; a value greater than 0 if this customer's username is lexicographically greater than the give customer's username.

      • traverseReserveQueue

        public java.lang.String traverseReserveQueue()
        Gets the list of movies in this customer's reserve queue. Each movie name is on it's own line.
        Returns:
        list of movie names in this customer's reserve queue.

      • traverseAtHomeQueue

        public java.lang.String traverseAtHomeQueue()
        Gets the list of movies that this customer currently has at home. Each movie name is on its own line.
        Returns:
        list of movie names that this customer currently has at home.

      • closeAccount

        public void closeAccount()
        Unreserves all movies in the reserve queue and returns all movies at home.

      • returnDVD

        public void returnDVD(int index)
        Returns the DVD at the specified index to the movie inventory and checks out the next movie in the reserve.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the DVD to return.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index given is out of bounds.

      • moveAheadOneInReserves

        public void moveAheadOneInReserves(int index)
        Moves the movie at the specified index in the reserve queue forward one in the list.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the movie to move.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index given is out of bounds.

      • unReserve

        public void unReserve(int index)
        Removes the movie in the given position from the reserve queue. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the index is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the movie to be removed from the reserve queue.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index given is out of bounds.

      • reserve

        public void reserve(Movie movie)
        Places the movie at the end of this customer's reserve queue. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the index is out of bounds and the movie given is null.
        Parameters:
        movie - Movie to be reserved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Movie object given is null.
